record.title: ORDERS FOR FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 28, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 28, 2007 -- (Senate - September 27, 2007)

[Page: S12316]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 10:30 a.m., Friday, September 28; that on Friday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day; that the Senate then resume consideration of H.R. 1585.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
